author: Tony Tobin
method: For the raisin purée, place the raisins, white wine and sugar in a medium saucepan over a medium heat and let it simmer for eight minutes, until thickened. Blend the raisin mixture in a blender and let it cool. To serve, place the purée on a plate with the cheese and serve with crusty bread.
ingredients: 100g/3½ oz raisins,  100ml/3½fl oz white wine,  4 tbsp brown sugar,  50g/ 1¾ oz Stilton, at room temperature,  1 loaf of crusty bread
